meanings.definition: To change the form or character of something.
meanings.sent1: She was recasting her old dress into a new design.
meanings.sent2: The director decided to recast the lead role in the play.
meanings.sent3: Recasting the furniture in the room made it look completely different.
meanings.sent4: Her smile recast her face in a more cheerful light.
meanings.sent5: The artist recasting the clay sculpture with great care and precision.

meanings.definition: To present in a different way.
meanings.sent1: The teacher was recasting the lesson to make it easier for the students to understand.
meanings.sent2: The news anchor recast the story with a fresh perspective.
meanings.sent3: Recasting the joke with a funny accent made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her words recast the situation in a more positive light.
meanings.sent5: The magician recasting his trick to amaze the audience even more.

meanings.sent1: The sculptor was recasting the clay figure to fix a mistake.
meanings.sent2: The artisan recast the metal piece to achieve a smoother finish.
meanings.sent3: Recasting the dough into a ball, she started kneading it again.
meanings.sent4: His experience recast his perspective on life.
meanings.sent5: The potter recasting the vase to give it a more elegant shape.
